Course Title: Microprocessor
Course Description: This course introduces the working principles of computer. It puts emphasis on both software and hardware, as well as on the theory and practice of microprocessor. In general, this course will cover the topics including introduction to general microprocessors, microprocessor software architecture and operation, assembly language programming, machine language coding,  integer and control flow instructions and program structures, and the memory and I/O interfaces.
schedule:
Week1~2: Course Overview & Introduction to the Microprocessor and Microcomputer
Week3~4: Software Architecture of the 8088 and 8086 Microprocessors
Week5~6: Assembly Language Programming
Week7~8: Machine Coding & Debug Software Development Program
Week9: Midterm Exam.
Week10~11: 8088/8086 Programming - Integer Instructions and Computations
Week12~13: 8088/8086 Programming - Control Flow Instructions and Program Structures
Week14~15: Assembly Language Program Development with MASM
Week16~17: The 8088 and 8086 Microprocessors and Their Memory and Input/Output Interfaces
Week18: Final Exam.
